page.title: 16ATTITUDES IN GILLING WEST
page.content:
The residents of Gilling think that life in the 1980s has been made easier with the help of modern technology. Modern conveniences such as washing machines and vacuum cleaners have made housework easier for most people. Better housing is available. Communication is easier and there are opportunities for wider travel on improved roads and transport. Senior citizens are well cared for,and there are better medical facilities.
People today are concerned about the widespread unemployment,particularly among young people. They are also concerned about moral standards -high divorce rate,break-down of family life and the rise in crime. The possibility of nuclear war is also a major concern.
